header.summary: I like to build autonomous systems

experience.description: Core developer for the OPENSEA autonomy platform, deploying mission-critical GNC software to commercial underwater fleets. Specifically, I engineered solutions for SLAM-based navigation, sensor fusion, and obstacle avoidance on the 'EverClean' hull-cleaning robots, 'Bayonet' amphibious crawlers.

R&D focus on multi-agent coordination between autonomous air and ground vehicles in unstructured, off-road environments. I engineered real-time perception pipelines (LiDAR to 2D Costmap) and developed local planners for obstacle avoidance.

Designed and validated data-driven, nonlinear control architectures for a drive-by-wire UTV. I developed system identification models to characterize vehicle dynamics and implemented Sliding Mode Controllers for precise off-road path tracking.
I designed, developed, and applied controls for a commercial vehicle. The team ultimately won 2nd place overall.

projects.name: GPT - The Office
projects.description: A Generative Pretrained Model (GPT) using a decoder architecture similar to "Attention is All You Need," trained on scripts from "The Office" to generate dialogue in the show's style. Implements custom character-wise and GPT-2 tokenization methods. Originally trained on a single GPU, with future plans to scale to multi-GPU distributed training.

projects.name: Rust Robotics
projects.description: Currently, this includes some basic downstream algorithms (system modeling, path tracking, and controls). The goal is to create algorithms for majority of the autonomy pipeline from sensor data processing to controls.

projects.name: samirhassen.com
projects.description: I'm not a frontend developer by any means, but I created this portfolio website using Brittany Chiang's website as inspiration. I learned and executed ideas in an unfamiliar domain.
